snippet: The agency’s decision to prohibit the industrial chemical bisphenol A in baby bottles and children’s drinking cups came upon the request of the chemical industry.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration says baby bottles and children's drinking cups can no longer contain the industrial chemical bisphenol A; manufacturers have already stopped using it in baby bottles and sippy cups; FDA says its decision is response to a request from the chemical industry; substance can still be used in other containers, including for formula.
lead_paragraph: The agency’s decision to prohibit the industrial chemical bisphenol A in baby bottles and children’s drinking cups came upon the request of the chemical industry.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Bans BPA From Baby Bottles and Sippy Cups
headline.main: F.D.A. Makes It Official: BPA Can’t Be Used in Baby Bottles and Cups
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Makes It Official: Chemical Can’t Be Used In Baby Bottles and Cups
